info.title: CoinGecko Price Assistant API
info.description: API for retrieving the latest price data on cryptocurrency tokens using CoinGecko's data.

assistant.name: CoinGecko Price Assistant
assistant.description: CoinGecko Assistant is an AI helper with full access to CoinGecko's Public API. It can provide users with real-time cryptocurrency data, including prices, market information, charts, and trends.
assistant.instructions:
The CoinGecko Price Assistant can help users access various endpoints of the CoinGecko API. Here are some of the most popular use cases it can assist with:

1. Price Queries: The assistant can fetch current prices, 24h changes, and market caps for any cryptocurrency. It should use the /simple/price endpoint for quick price checks or /coins/markets for more detailed market data.

2. Coin Details: For in-depth information on a specific coin, including description, links, and market data, the assistant should use the /coins/{id} endpoint.

3. Historical Data: To provide price history or create charts, the assistant should utilize endpoints like /coins/{id}/market_chart or /coins/{id}/ohlc.

4. Trending Coins: The assistant can share the most popular coins in the last 24 hours using the /search/trending endpoint.

5. Global Market Overview: For a bird's-eye view of the crypto market, including total market cap and dominance, the assistant should use the /global endpoint.

6. Exchange Data: To provide information on exchanges, including volume and trust score, the assistant should use the /exchanges and related endpoints.

7. Search: If a user is looking for a specific coin or exchange, the assistant can use the /search endpoint to find the correct information.

When users ask for cryptocurrency information, the assistant should interpret their request, select the appropriate API endpoint, format the query correctly, and return the relevant data in a clear, easy-to-understand format. It should also offer to provide additional context or explanations if needed.

The assistant should remember that while it has access to a wealth of data, it doesn't provide financial advice. Its role is to inform and assist users in accessing cryptocurrency data to support their own research and decision-making.

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **check the API server status**.
This endpoint allows you to **query the prices of one or more coins by using their unique Coin API IDs**.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: coins' ids, comma-separated if querying more than 1 coin.

parameters.name: vs_currencies
parameters.description:
target currency of coins, comma-separated if querying more than 1 currency.
*refers to [`/simple/supported_vs_currencies`](/reference/simple-supported-currencies).

parameters.name: include_last_updated_at
parameters.description: include last updated price time in UNIX, default: false

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: decimal place for currency price value

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query a token price by using token contract address**.

parameters.name: contract_addresses
parameters.description: the contract addresses of tokens, comma-separated if querying more than 1 token's contract address

parameters.name: vs_currencies
parameters.description:
target currency of coins, comma-separated if querying more than 1 currency.
*refers to [`/simple/supported_vs_currencies`](/reference/simple-supported-currencies).

parameters.name: include_last_updated_at
parameters.description: include last updated price time in UNIX , default: false

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: decimal place for currency price value

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query all the supported currencies on CoinGecko**.
This endpoint allows you to **query all the coin data of a coin (name, price, market .... including exchange tickers) on CoinGecko coin page based on a particular coin id**.

parameters.name: localization
parameters.description: include all the localized languages in the response, default: true

parameters.name: sparkline
parameters.description: include sparkline 7 days data, default: false

200.description: Get current data for a coin

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query the coin tickers on both centralized exchange (cex) and decentralized exchange (dex) based on a particular coin id**.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: use this to sort the order of responses, default: trust_score_desc

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description:
include 2% orderbook depth, ie. `cost_to_move_up_usd` and `cost_to_move_down_usd`
default: false

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query the historical data (price, market cap, 24hrs volume, etc) at a given date for a coin based on a particular coin id**.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
the date of data snapshot
Format: `dd-mm-yyyy`

parameters.name: localization
parameters.description: include all the localized languages in response, default: true

200.description: Get historical data (name, price, market, stats) at a given date for a coin

get.summary: Coin Historical Chart Data by ID
get.description: This endpoint allows you to **get the historical chart data of a coin including time in UNIX, price, market cap and 24hrs volume based on particular coin id**.

parameters.name: vs_currency
parameters.description:
target currency of market data
*refers to [`/simple/supported_vs_currencies`](/reference/simple-supported-currencies).

parameters.name: days
parameters.description:
data up to number of days ago
you may use any integer for number of days

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: data interval, leave empty for auto granularity Possible value: daily

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: decimal place for currency price value

200.description: Get historical market data include price, market cap, and 24h volume (granularity auto)

get.summary: Coin Historical Chart Data within Time Range by ID
get.description: This endpoint allows you to **get the historical chart data of a coin within certain time range in UNIX along with price, market cap and 24hrs volume based on particular coin id**.

parameters.name: vs_currency
parameters.description:
target currency of market data
*refers to [`/simple/supported_vs_currencies`](/reference/simple-supported-currencies).

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: decimal place for currency price value

200.description: Get historical market data include price, market cap, and 24h volume (granularity auto)

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **get the OHLC chart (Open, High, Low, Close) of a coin based on particular coin id**.

parameters.name: vs_currency
parameters.description:
target currency of price data
*refers to [`/simple/supported_vs_currencies`](/reference/simple-supported-currencies).

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: data up to number of days ago

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: decimal place for currency price value

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query all the coin data (name, price, market .... including exchange tickers) on CoinGecko coin page based on asset platform and particular token contract address**.

200.description: Get current data for a coin

get.summary: Coin Historical Chart Data by Token Address
get.description: This endpoint allows you to **get the historical chart data including time in UNIX, price, market cap and 24hrs volume based on asset platform and particular token contract address**.

parameters.name: vs_currency
parameters.description:
target currency of market data
*refers to [`/simple/supported_vs_currencies`](/reference/simple-supported-currencies).

parameters.name: days
parameters.description:
data up to number of days ago
you may use any integer for number of days

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: data interval, leave empty for auto granularity Possible value: daily

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: decimal place for currency price value

200.description: Get historical market data include price, market cap, and 24h volume

get.summary: Coin Historical Chart Data within Time Range by Token Address
get.description: This endpoint allows you to **get the historical chart data within certain time range in UNIX along with price, market cap and 24hrs volume  based on asset platform and particular token contract address**.

parameters.name: vs_currency
parameters.description:
target currency of market data
*refers to [`/simple/supported_vs_currencies`](/reference/simple-supported-currencies).

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: decimal place for currency price value

200.description: Get historical market data include price, market cap, and 24h volume

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query all the asset platforms on CoinGecko**.
This endpoint allows you to **query all the coins categories on CoinGecko**.

get.summary: Coins Categories List with Market Data
get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query all the coins categories with market data (market cap, volume, etc.) on CoinGecko**.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: sort results by field, default: market_cap_desc

200.description: List all categories with market data

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query all the supported exchanges with exchanges’ data (id, name, country, .... etc) that have active trading volumes on CoinGecko**.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description:
total results per page, default: 100
Valid values: 1...250

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query all the exchanges with id and name**.

200.description: List all exchanges with id and name

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query exchange’s data (name, year established, country, .... etc), exchange volume in BTC and top 100 tickers based on exchange’s id**.

200.description: Get exchange volume in BTC and top 100 tickers only

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query exchange's tickers based on exchange’s id**.

parameters.name: coin_ids
parameters.description: filter tickers by coin_ids, comma-separated if querying more than 1 coin

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: include 2% orderbook depth (Example: cost_to_move_up_usd & cost_to_move_down_usd),default: false

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: use this to sort the order of responses, default: trust_score_desc

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query the historical volume chart data with time in UNIX and trading volume data in BTC based on exchange’s id**.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
exchange id or derivatives exchange id
*refers to [`/exchanges/list`](/reference/exchanges-list) or [`/derivatives/exchanges/list`](/reference/derivatives-exchanges-list).

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: data up to number of days ago

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query all the tickers from derivatives exchanges on CoinGecko**.
This endpoint allows you to **query all the derivatives exchanges with related data (id, name, open interest, .... etc) on CoinGecko**.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: use this to sort the order of responses, default: open_interest_btc_desc

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query the derivatives exchange’s related data (id, name, open interest, .... etc) based on the exchanges’ id**.
This endpoint allows you to **query all the derivatives exchanges with id and name on CoinGecko**.

200.description: List all derivative exchanges name and identifier

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query all supported NFTs with id, contract address, name, asset platform id and symbol on CoinGecko**.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: use this to sort the order of responses

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description:
total results per page
Valid values: 1...250

get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query all the NFT data (name, floor price, 24 hr volume....) based on the nft collection id**.

get.summary: NFTs Collection Data by Contract Address
get.description: This endpoint allows you to **query all the NFT data (name, floor price, 24 hr volume....) based on the nft collection contract address and respective asset platform**.
This endpoint allows you to **query BTC exchange rates with other currencies**.
This endpoint allows you to **search for coins, categories and markets listed on CoinGecko**.

200.description: List of coins, categories and markets matching search term ordered by market cap

get.description: This endpoint allows you **query trending search coins, nfts and categories on CoinGecko in the last 24 hours**.

200.description: List trending coins by most popular first

get.description: This endpoint allows you **query cryptocurrency global data including active cryptocurrencies, markets, total crypto market cap and etc**.
This endpoint allows you **query top 100 cryptocurrency global decentralized finance (defi) data including defi market cap, trading volume**.

200.description: Get cryptocurrency global decentralized finance (defi) data

get.description: This endpoint allows you **query public companies’ bitcoin or ethereum holdings**.

content.title: What is GALA?
content.description: Gala is a blockchain gaming ecosystem. Gamers can explore different type of games and have their experiences interact across each other on the Gala platform. The GALA token is the utility token and primary medium of exchange of the ecosystem. Game items are represented as NFTs on the Ethereum blockchain and users can trade them on all marketplaces.
